intro: Matelea lanata, commonly known as the woolly matelea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive, velvety appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent, spurred corona. Matelea lanata is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
